content:
• Friday, October 19, 2012
  • MSN

    Emerson Radio (NYSEMKT:MSN) says Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) has informed the company it will no longer...

    Emerson Radio (NYSEMKT:MSN) says Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) has informed the company it will no longer sell two microwave products which accounted for approximately 48% of EMR's net revenues during FY12. Emerson will continue shipping these products throughout the remainder of FY13, with sales declining in 4Q13. Emerson anticipates that the full impact of Wal-Mart’s decision will be realized by the company in FY14. Shares -6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM | 4 Comments
  • CALL

    The magic continues for magicJack VocalTec (CALL +12.8%): After reporting strong Q3 results, CEO...

    The magic continues for magicJack VocalTec (CALL +12.8%): After reporting strong Q3 results, CEO Dan Borislow says there's a "good chance" the company will see earnings for the year of more than $2/share. Guidance already was boosted last month to a range of $1.70-$1.80/share.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZIOP

    Ziopharm Oncology (ZIOP -6.2%) drops following a blog report in Forbes.com that accuses the...

    Ziopharm Oncology (ZIOP -6.2%) drops following a blog report in Forbes.com that accuses the company of failing to disclose an FDA warning letter. The blogger, an investor short on the stock, says the FDA admonished a clinical investigator hired by ZIOP for multiple violations in a mid-stage study of Palifosfamide, its investigational cancer drug. The study in question has since advanced into a late-stage trial with results expected before 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • MTW

    Manitowoc (MTW +4.5%) shares pop on a story making the rounds that the capital goods...

    Manitowoc (MTW +4.5%) shares pop on a story making the rounds that the capital goods manufacturer is seeing interest from Italy's Ali Group.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • AAPL

    After seeing Verizon report it sold just ~650K iPhone 5s in Q3 due to supply issues, Jefferies'...

    After seeing Verizon report it sold just ~650K iPhone 5s in Q3 due to supply issues, Jefferies' Peter Misek thinks only 5M units may have been sold overall in the quarter - he previously believed sales of 8M-10M were possible. But Misek argues iPhone 4/4S sales will make up for any shortfall to his 26M-unit iPhone forecast. Meanwhile, Stifel notes the iPhone 5 is still back-ordered for 3 weeks at Verizon. Apple (AAPL -2.8%) is selling off along with many other tech large caps, and is down 13% from its Sep. 21 high. (earlier: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 59 Comments
  • APA

    Apache (APA -2%) is delaying its proposed $3B Kitimat project, as rivals have undercut APA's...

    Apache (APA -2%) is delaying its proposed $3B Kitimat project, as rivals have undercut APA's ability to sign customers to long-term supply contracts and left Kitimat without enough clients to begin construction. Cheniere Energy (NYSEMKT:LNG) has offered liquefied natural gas at prices based on the cheaper Henry Hub benchmark, spurring potential APA buyers to drive a harder bargain, analysts say.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 6 Comments
  • SVU

    Supervalu (SVU +3%) adds to yesterday's gains as the company's disclosure that it has...

    Supervalu (SVU +3%) adds to yesterday's gains as the company's disclosure that it has indications of interest brings in speculative buyers. Though P-E firms may be crunching the numbers on some kind of buyout, don't look for a sector rival to make a bid. The key point is that other grocery sellers - including Wal-Mart and discounting stores - are picking up the market share for free as Supervalu bleeds customer traffic.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 8 Comments
  • APD

    Air Products & Chemicals (APD -6.1%) drops to its lows of the day after reporting a...

    Air Products & Chemicals (APD -6.1%) drops to its lows of the day after reporting a quarterly profit that barely met its own forecast and predicting earnings for FY 2013 well short of Wall Street expectations. Credit Suisse cuts shares to Neutral from Outperform. "We are starting our 2013 fiscal year with weak economic momentum world-wide," CEO John McGlade says.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • MNK

    Insurers are taking an even more cautious stance on Questcor's (QCOR -4.1%) Acthar, according to...

    Insurers are taking an even more cautious stance on Questcor's (QCOR -4.1%) Acthar, according to a Citron Research report. The short seller is now claiming that Humana (HUM -1.5%) has issued a new Commercial Preauthorization document containing a new, specifically asterisked preauthorization for reimbursement for Acthar, which it contends is part of a pattern of insurers taking a more restrictive stance on authorization policy with regard to the drug's reimbursement.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 40 Comments
  • MM

    Volatile Millennial Media (MM -6.2%) is posting big losses a day after top rival Google said its...

    Volatile Millennial Media (MM -6.2%) is posting big losses a day after top rival Google said its mobile business (dominated by ads) is on an $8B/year run rate, but also reported a 15% Y/Y ad price decline that was likely influenced by mobile. Earlier this week, the CEO of Jumptap, another Millennial rival, said his company is considering an IPO or a sale - Millennial could be an option if the latter is the case. (Q3 pre-announcement)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • IONS

    Isis Pharmaceutical (ISIS -3.6%) shares slip lower despite the FDA's announcement that it's...

    Isis Pharmaceutical (ISIS -3.6%) shares slip lower despite the FDA's announcement that it's recommended approval of Kynamro for the treatment of Hypercholesterolemia, as analysts dig deeper into the recommendation's details, which the FDA is not required to follow. Jefferies notes that the approval could be "very limited," while a Seeking Alpha report suggests that competitor Aegerion Pharma's (AEGR -5%) Lomitapide could be a better choice, with a more decisive vote from the committee and none of the safety concerns of Kynamro.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • MMR

    McMoRan Exploration (MMR -5.1%) swoons after its bigger-than-expected Q3 loss, hurt by a jump in...

    McMoRan Exploration (MMR -5.1%) swoons after its bigger-than-expected Q3 loss, hurt by a jump in exploration costs and a production drop from Hurricane Isaac. Production fell 28% to 134MMcfe/day vs. 135 expected. Operations to clear the well bore at the Davy Jones No. 1 well were pushed back again; flow tests have been delayed for more than a year due to technical problems.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • GURE

    Midday top 10 gainers: GURE +18%. RVBD +13%. CALL +12%. EFUT +10%. MAN +9%. NCTY +9%. FWRD +8%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: GURE +18%. RVBD +13%. CALL +12%. EFUT +10%. MAN +9%. NCTY +9%. FWRD +8%. USCR +8%. XIN +7%. CCIH +6%.
    Top 10 Losers: CBLI -24%. PXLW -22%. MIG -21%. ZIOP -17%. VOC -15%. CMG -15%. MRVL -14%. AMD -14%. OTC:BGMD -14%. CEMP -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • GERN

    Geron's (GERN -7.9%) board acknowledges receiving a letter from BioTime (BTX -3.3%) offering to...

    Geron's (GERN -7.9%) board acknowledges receiving a letter from BioTime (BTX -3.3%) offering to buy its stem cell assets, saying it will review and act in a manner that it believes will be in the best interests of GERN's stockholders. The board adds that it's been considering a number of alternatives since its announcement earlier this month that it was discontinuing its stem cell research and development programs.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • CYT

    Specialty chemical and materials manufacturer Cytec Industries (CYT +1%) trades up this morning,...

    Specialty chemical and materials manufacturer Cytec Industries (CYT +1%) trades up this morning, bucking a disappointing Q3 earning result late yesterday. Despite the miss, earnings were strong, with net income rising 11% Y/Y on strength from acquisitions and solid sales in two of its three business segments. The company also raised its Q4 earnings guidance range, now expecting an FY12 adjusted EPS of $2.84 - $3.03. This number includes a tax benefit however, and thus may not be comparable to the Street estimate of $2.90.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • VOC

    VOC Energy Trust (VOC -16.7%) plunges after announcing a quarterly distribution. VOC warns of...

    VOC Energy Trust (VOC -16.7%) plunges after announcing a quarterly distribution. VOC warns of declining production volumes for its Kurten Woodbine properties due to an abandoned horizontal well: "Future distributions to the Trust from the net profits interest will be impacted by this event."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • CY

    Cypress Semi (CY -3.7%) is adding to the 8% drop it saw yesterday following its Q3 report:...

    Cypress Semi (CY -3.7%) is adding to the 8% drop it saw yesterday following its Q3 report: though results weren't bad, the chipmaker guided on its earnings call for Q4 revenue of $186M-$192M and EPS of $0.12-$0.15 (after accounting for the Ramtron acquisition), below a consensus of $198M and $0.17. Cypress also mentioned its book-to-bill was a mere 0.81. Nomura is staying positive, touting Cypress' operating leverage, dividend, and buybacks. Rivals are also lower: ATML -3.1%. IDTI -3.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • DVR

    Cal Dive (DVR +4.7%) announces international awards expected to generate ~$20M in revenues...

    Cal Dive (DVR +4.7%) announces international awards expected to generate ~$20M in revenues during 2013. DVR recently began a two-year charter of the DP saturation diving vessel Kestrel to a contractor in Mexico to perform repair and maintenance work for Pemex. DVR also was awarded three saturation diving contracts in Australia.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • MRK

    Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST -3%) slips on a mixed Q3 report yesterday, beating on its EPS but...

    Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST -3%) slips on a mixed Q3 report yesterday, beating on its EPS but missing on revenue estimates. Net earnings rose 66% Y/Y as the company continued to see strong growth for its intravenous antibiotic Cubicin, but it also cut guidance going forward. The bio-pharmaceutical developer now sees revenue in the range of $915M - $931M, below Street estimates of $931M.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • TVTY

    Healthways (HWAY -11.3%) slips after its Q3 beat on its bottom line but came up short on revenue...

    Healthways (HWAY -11.3%) slips after its Q3 beat on its bottom line but came up short on revenue late yesterday. Net earnings fell 47% Y/Y as revenue was hurt by the continued wind-down of a contract with Cigna Corp. (NYSE:CI). The company also lowered its full-year earnings estimates and narrowed its sales view due to higher operational costs as well as reduced revenue from two contracts that were renewed early.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR -8.4%) falls some more after SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son says he remains open to...

    Clearwire (CLWR -8.4%) falls some more after SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son says he remains open to bidding on MetroPCS, a move that would further lower the odds of Sprint buying Clearwire in full near-term. Shares have already tumbled this week in response to other bad news (I, II) on this front, but remain up 45% since the first reports of a Sprint/SoftBank deal arrived.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 10 Comments
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD -6.3%) and Marvell (MRVL -11.9%) get downgraded to Market Perform by FBR's Craig Berger...

    AMD (AMD -6.3%) and Marvell (MRVL -11.9%) get downgraded to Market Perform by FBR's Craig Berger after providing more bad news (I, II) yesterday afternoon. Berger is worried about AMD's cash burn, lack of gross margin guidance, and upcoming price cuts, and thinks Marvell's loss of CFO Clyde Hosein is an indictment of its "culture and founder-CEO control" - he considers rival LSI-OLD a better buy. Also downgraded is Nvidia (NVDA -2.1%), for which Berger cites general PC worries. (AMD transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 9 Comments
  • LULU

    Lululemon (LULU -4%) trades weak after momo-compadre Chipotle issues a worrisome Q3 report and...

    Lululemon (LULU -4%) trades weak after momo-compadre Chipotle issues a worrisome Q3 report and with a negative note out from Credit Suisse on the name.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • ETFC

    E*Trade (ETFC -7%) dives following last night's earnings showing a surprising rise in loan loss...

    E*Trade (ETFC -7%) dives following last night's earnings showing a surprising rise in loan loss provisions. News from company operations is little better: Daily Average Revenue Trades (DARTS) slumped 7% from last quarter and 22% from the same quarter a year ago. Net new brokerage accounts were 18K vs. 46K in Q2. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 1 Comment

  • Cleveland BioLabs -20.6% premarket to $1.97 as it prices a $15M offering of stock and warrants...

    Cleveland BioLabs -20.6% premarket to $1.97 as it prices a $15M offering of stock and warrants at $2/unit. The offering closes around next Wednesday.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • CCC-OLD

    Calgon Carbon (NYSE:CCC-OLD) -5.5% premarket after warning of an expected Q3 loss, as the...

    Calgon Carbon (NYSE:CCC-OLD) -5.5% premarket after warning of an expected Q3 loss, as the provider of products and services for purifying water and air anticipates a series of special charges and weaker-than-expected sales. Q3 sales are estimated at $135M vs. $145M analyst consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) +1.7% after SA's Helix Investment makes a bull case, albeit while doubting...

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) +1.7% after SA's Helix Investment makes a bull case, albeit while doubting it will be acquired by an OEM partner due to the fact a deal would disrupt other partnerships. Helix notes the early success of Fusion-io's ION software platform for building flash storage systems based on its hardware, and also the popularity of its ioTurbine caching software (previous) in virtualization deployments. It also holds out some hope Intel, which isn't burdened by OEM conflicts, will consider a bid.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • PNRA

    Panera Bread (NASDAQ:PNRA) falls 1.8% in premarket action after reports from Chipotle and...

    Panera Bread (NASDAQ:PNRA) falls 1.8% in premarket action after reports from Chipotle and McDonald's tip sentiment on the restaurant name. Though the company continues to take market share impressively, as a high-growth, high P-E story it also catches questions on market saturation and valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • DRYS

    Shipping stocks could see volatility after Deutsche Bank clips its rating on Genco Shipping. If...

    Shipping stocks could see volatility after Deutsche Bank clips its rating on Genco Shipping. If history is any guide, when one sector name sneezes the rest catch a cold. On watch: DRYS, PRGN, EXM, FRO, OSG, NAT, OSK, TNK, TNP.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • SVNTQ

    Premarket gainers: SVNT +12%. RVBD +11%. CALL +7%. SNDK +7%. Losers: CBLI -20%. ATHN -11%. CMG...

    Premarket gainers: SVNT +12%. RVBD +11%. CALL +7%. SNDK +7%.
    Losers: CBLI -20%. ATHN -11%. CMG -11%. MRVL -9%. PH -9%. ETFC -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • GNK

    Deutsche Bank downgrades Genco Shipping (NYSE:GNK) on a valuation call after shares ran higher...

    Deutsche Bank downgrades Genco Shipping (NYSE:GNK) on a valuation call after shares ran higher in Q3 with shipping rates improving. The firm still sees choppy waters ahead for the industry in general. Shares -10.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • YUM

    Yum Brands (YUM +1%) falls 1.5% in premarket trading after McDonald's issues its relatively weak...

    Yum Brands (YUM +1%) falls 1.5% in premarket trading after McDonald's issues its relatively weak Q3 report and early warning on Q4. On the topic of rivals in the space, the company was referred to indirectly yesterday during Chipotle's CC (transcript) when execs maintained their company wasn't losing significant transactions to someone else because its model isn't easy to copy. Look for Q4 to help resolve the Chipotle vs. Taco Bell debate with Cantina Bell putting in a full quarter worth of results.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM
  • CPNO

    Copano Energy (NASDAQ:CPNO) -4% premarket after announcing a public offering of 6M common units...

    Copano Energy (NASDAQ:CPNO) -4% premarket after announcing a public offering of 6M common units at $32.13 each. CPNO intends to use the proceeds to pay down debt and for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM
  • GE

    More on GE Q3 earnings: The company - in the presentation materials for its earnings conference...

    More on GE Q3 earnings: The company - in the presentation materials for its earnings conference call - lowers its full year revenue growth estimate to about 3% from a previous 5%. Given the year's almost over, it implies GE is expecting below-forecast results for Q4. Shares -2.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM | 6 Comments
  • BHGE

    More on Baker Hughes' (BHI) Q3 results: Operating income fell 27% Q/Q due to margin pressure...

    More on Baker Hughes' (BHI) Q3 results: Operating income fell 27% Q/Q due to margin pressure across all regions globally. North American margins narrowed to 11.7% from 13.4%, negatively affected by ongoing price declines in the pressure pumping market. Overall revenues and margins globally were less than the company had anticipated. BHI -3.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM | 1 Comment
  • MCD

    More on McDonald's (NYSE:MCD): The Golden Arches achieves the consistency it was looking for,...

    More on McDonald's (NYSE:MCD): The Golden Arches achieves the consistency it was looking for, but mainly on the downside as higher commodity and labor costs cut into earnings. Even after factoring in the effect of the strong U.S. dollar on results and decent numbers in Australia and China, the overriding theme is dominated by the sub-2% growth seen across major regions. Expect some Q&A on those "negative" October trends at the firm's earnings call slated for 9:00 AM EST. MCD -2.1%. (webcast)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM | 2 Comments
  • MCD

    More on McDonald's (NYSE:MCD): The company sees "challenging conditions" lead to sluggishness...

    More on McDonald's (NYSE:MCD): The company sees "challenging conditions" lead to sluggishness across the globe. Global comparable sales up 1.9% Y/Y, with Asia/Pacific, Middle East and Africa sales rising a disappointing 1.4% and U.S. sales on the weak side with a 1.2% pace. Pricing initiatives helped boost Europe which saw 1.8% comparable sales growth off of negative guest traffic. The short-term outlook is painted bleak, with Q4 sales trending "negative." MCD -2.3%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM | 3 Comments
  • MCD

    McDonald's (NYSE:MCD): Q3 EPS of $1.43 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $7.15B (-13.9% Y/Y) in-line....

    McDonald's (NYSE:MCD): Q3 EPS of $1.43 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $7.15B (-13.9% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM | 6 Comments
  • PH

    More on Parker-Hannifin (NYSE:PH) FQ1 earnings: In addition to the miss, the company trims its...

    More on Parker-Hannifin (NYSE:PH) FQ1 earnings: In addition to the miss, the company trims its full FY2013 guidance to EPS of $6.15-$6.75 from $7.10-$7.90. FQ1 industrial orders -11% Y/Y in North America, -8% internationally. Shares -9.5% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM
  • MAN

    Manpower (NYSE:MAN): Q3 EPS of $0.79 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $5.2B (-11% Y/Y) beats by $90M....

    Manpower (NYSE:MAN): Q3 EPS of $0.79 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $5.2B (-11% Y/Y) beats by $90M. Shares +2.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM
  • CMG

    A chart on Chipotle's (NYSE:CMG) full-year guidance over the years put together by Baird tells a...

    A chart on Chipotle's (NYSE:CMG) full-year guidance over the years put together by Baird tells a different story than some of the doom and gloom calls put out on the restaurant chain after its sluggish quarter and guidance. At the very least, it can be noted the company has a long history of setting itself up to beat its own estimates. CMG -10.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM | 1 Comment

  • EU shares are lower in mid-morning trading despite the EU taking steps towards the creation of a...

    EU shares are lower in mid-morning trading despite the EU taking steps towards the creation of a banking supervisor, with shares weighed down by Microsoft's and Google's earnings misses. Euro Stoxx 50 -0.4%, London -0.1%, Paris -0.2%, Frankfurt -0.3%, Milan -0.8%, Madrid -1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 AM

  • Asian shares are mixed, with tech stocks dragged down by the Google earnings fiasco as well as...

    Asian shares are mixed, with tech stocks dragged down by the Google earnings fiasco as well as Microsoft's disappointing results. Japan +0.2%, Hong Kong +0.1%, China -0.2%, India -0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 AM
